TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HtmlSelectBuilder extends System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder

Docs.summary: Interacts with the parser to build an control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelectBuilder> control interacts with the page parser to build an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelect> control. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelectBuilder> control to customize the parsing of an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelect> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelectBuilder.AllowWhitespaceLiterals%2A> property is set to `false` so that white space is always ignored. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelectBuilder.GetChildControlType%2A> method to determine the type of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelect> control's child controls.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelectBuilder> control that defines two types of `<option>` child elements of a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelect> control and then processes each type differently.

block.para: To create a custom control builder for an control, you need to inherit from this class.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > This constructor is used by ASP.NET when parsing the page and creating the control hierarchy. It is not intended for use in your code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool AllowWhitespaceLiterals() cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether the white space literals in an control are to be processed or ignored.
Docs.returns: This method always returns , indicating that white space in the control is ignored.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder.AllowWhitespaceLiterals%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to always ignore white space in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelect> control.

MemberSignature.Value: public override Type GetChildControlType (string tagName, System.Collections.IDictionary attribs);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Type GetChildControlType(string tagName, class System.Collections.IDictionary attribs) cil managed

Docs.param: The tag name of the child control.
An array of attributes contained in the child control.
Docs.summary: Obtains the for the control's child controls.
Docs.returns: The of the control's specified child control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelectBuilder.GetChildControlType%2A> method to return the <xref:System.Type> of a specified child control in an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelect> control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelectBuilder.GetChildControlType%2A> method to check for custom child control types. For a complete, working code example, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlSelectBuilder> class overview topic.
